title: Reebok Men's Driftium Running Shoe
description:
Reebok was founded for one of the best reasons possible: athletes wanted to run faster. So in the 1890s, joseph william Foster made some of the first known running shoes with spikes in them. By 1895, he was in business making shoes by hand for top runners; and before long his fledgling company, j.W. Foster and sons, developed an international clientele of distinguished athletes.

features: Air Cushion: M MGRNDL women's air running shoes features air cushion design to provide cushioning and support for the feet, protect your knees.
Breathable Mesh: Double-layer knitted fabric upper designs with unique knitted structures make the upper more breathable and comfortable.
Memory Foam Sole: The memory foam insole and the low-density PU outsole offer these sneakers great cushioning.
Occasions: Slip on sneaker suits for daily, walking, running, shopping, traveling, working, driving, jogging, training, playing tennis, casual outdoor, etc.

Easy slip on sneakers: This style of shoelaces is more inclined to decoration, which is suitable for adjusting the tightness of the shoes themselves. Very easy on and off. Medium width. We recommend the wide feet to choose a half size up.

reviews.title: Cut Foot
reviews.text: At first glance these shoes looked ideal. The uppers are mesh and they tie. The black and white look sporty. But the shoes left a,cut on the top of my left foot. The piece that holds the lace is not padded and it rubbed and cut the top of the foot. The right one was okay. Just not acceptable. I suppose yoi could afgix pads to prevent the rubbing or better yet buy shoes without that problem.

reviews.title: Great for walking and running, on even or paved surfaces.
reviews.text:
[[VIDEOID:c1b550fb45bc70f6146cd85777443b05]] The M MGRNDL sneakers are light, a bit flexible, and the air cushion design provides a cushioned impact. They have a good grip on surfaces, so they provide stability.

They do look good and the upper mesh fabric has some breathable properties.

They do a good job when walking and running short distances.
I would have liked if they mold to the foot better and had softer fabric, but at this price point it might be hard to find.

The M MGRNDL might not provide a good experience when running on uneven surfaces. They are not as comfortable as other well known and higher priced (twice as much) running sneakers brands.
The air cushion do provide a bit of support and comfort when running on even ground, such as concrete, pavement, grass or sand.
They do provide some level of impact resistant and support on the feet.

title: Xero Shoes Men's HFS Running Shoes - Zero Drop, Lightweight & Barefoot Feel
features: A NEW LIGHTWEIGHT road running shoe. Foot-shaped for comfort. Built for speed!
Made in the USA or Imported
GRIP + COMFORT - Flexible to support natural foot motion, and grippy with its tire tread-inspired FeelTrue rubber sole

SHAPED FOR COMFORT, BUILT FOR SPEED - Xero HFS features a lightweight, minimalist build that contours to the shape of your feet. Its spacious toe-box allows you to splay, spread, and relax your toes for superior comfort
XERO DROP SOLE FOR PERFECT POSTURE - The Xero Drop sole offers a non-elevated heel and is low-to-the-ground - this allows for proper posture, balance, and agility for all-round performance

FLEX YOUR FEET, FEEL THE FLOOR - Our tire tread inspired patented 5.5mm FeelTrue sole strikes a balance between just-right protection and feedback - it delivers heel to toe cues to the brain for your best run ever. Allows your feet to bend and flex as nature intended

TRAVEL FRIENDLY, 5000 MILE WARRANTY - Xero HFS’ extra-durable construction is backed by our 5,000 Mile Feel the World Sole Promise. Being ultra-flexible, you can roll ‘em up and put in your pack or pocket for compact storage and easy travel
VEGAN FRIENDLY - Xero Shoes believes in promoting healthy and sustainable lifestyles which is why the HFS is made with zero animal products

reviews.title: Surpassed My Expectations
reviews.text: I feel like now I can write an honest review. I have run for years, 3 5k per week. My go to shoes were NB or Brooks and I loved them. Started seeing Xero Shoes pop up on social media and YouTube. I looked them for months and it seemed like a gimmick product. After some time I said ok I am going to try this shoe and see if they meet their hype. In July of this year I ordered the Prio Cross Trainer model. Now their instructions said adjust over a couple of weeks. Well I said hell no and put them to the test right out of the box. I wore them every chance I got for 30 days straight. I found them comfortable right out of the box and I did not experience any foot or leg discomfort during the break period. I began liking them the more I wore them. At day 31 I put my Brooks Adrenaline runners on. Within 15 mins I was aware of how unbalanced I was in that shoe and while walking around in my home said, I can’t wear these any more I have to put my Xero Shoes on. I swear I referred to them specifically. I have since purchased 2 pairs of the HFS model runners and they are my favorite shoe. I wear them every day. In my old shoes at the end of the day I would change to my slides, I literally have these on until I go to bed. Closest thing to walking barefoot and still having a shoe on.

reviews.title: If you like barefoot shoes give these a try.
reviews.text: I wear a size 11 in most running shoes. Ordered a 10 1/2 in this and it fits great. My feet are on wider side so shorter sizes work for me if the shoe is somewhat wide. Really comfortable and appears well made. I look forward to trying other models. Unlike many other barefoot manufacturers I didn’t see any irregularities in how the shoe was put together.

reviews.title: Comfortable as "bare foot" shoes
reviews.text: I have purchased 2 Xero Men's HFS Running Shoes - Zero Drop and I have been very happy and comfortable wearing them. I've successfully walked and run with them when I visited Philippines for a month and have gotten used to the "bare foot" concept. Although I'm still comfortable wearing my Adidas running shoes, I found myself to be wearing my bare foot shoes more often now as I really find them much lighter, comfortable (for bare foot shoes) and lighter/easier to pack on day or extended trips. I've only been wearing them for the last 2 months or so, so long term I would still need to see how they stand up.

reviews.title: Forms to feet
reviews.text: Really nice lightweight shoes that forms to feet rather than walking with slight incline on heel. One of the best work out shoes there are. Not for running or basket ball- in my opinion, though more for stretching, walking,  calisthenics, boxing or light aerobics.

title: ASICS Jolt Men's Running Shoe
description: Mens ASICS Jolt :: Durable, lightweight, synthetic overlays, neutral cushioning.

reviews.title: Affordable and comfortable
reviews.text:
Update: I decided to keep these. Ok, so I am ashamed to wear them with jeans and a tee, I tried them for everyday but couldn't get over what I'll call the "dad sneakers" look. But I took these for a run and wow! They're very comfortable. A little clunky but flexible enough for daily training and the cushion is just right for me, sightly on the plush side but not squishy. These are my new daily runners. I don't know how long they'll last, but for the price, if I get 200 miles, I'll be happy.

Also, if you're a 3e/4e and you like or need a wide toe box, these will deliver. I'm a smaller 4e but i need a wide toe box, especially since I'm not willing to give up my injinji toe socks. These are very spacious with plenty of room for my toe splay.

-----

Original review: From the product pictures I wasn't sure if I'd like them or hate them. But for the price I figured I might as well try them. They fit nicely, have moderate cushion, and they're more flexible than I expected. They're basic sneakers, no bells or whistles. But they're comfortable enough I would try running in them. They're certainly not fashion forward, but I wouldn't be ashamed to wear them with jeans and a tee. And if you're looking for extra-wide these fit like a true 4e. I expected to hate them but I'm pleasantly surprised and I'll probably keep them and use they for everyday sneakers or runners.

reviews.title: a lite duty general purpose shoe
reviews.text:
I hd to send back my normal size, a 9EEE, for a size larger. I've had this variation in size before with New Balance so beware. I'm still giving it 5 stars for style and price.

You may have noticed that price varies considerably with the color sub/style you choose. Mine were only $21 while others are substantially more. I assume construction is the same on all of them? Maybe the price is based on the current inventory? My price dropped slightly after I ordered.

While it is sold as a running shoe (?) and is probably adequate for this purpose a serious high mileage runner would probably pay more to get more. If you can get the right price point as I did they are certainly worth a try as a general purpose/athletic/walking shoe.

title: Brooks Women's Bedlam 3 Running Shoe
features: THIS WOMEN'S SHOE IS FOR: The Bedlam 3 is perfect for runners who want a shoe that helps them by giving energy back with each step and supports the way their body naturally wants to move.
ENERGIZED CUSHIONING: Built with our best energy return, the DNA AMP midsole gives you back more of the effort you put in.
SECURE, SOCK-LIKE FIT: Redesigned Fit Knit upper provides a secure, sock-like fit that moves with you.

GUIDERAILS HOLISTIC SUPPORT SYSTEM: We’ve shifted our focus beyond the feet to the most injury-prone part of a runner’s body: the knees. GuideRails support keeps you moving comfortably by keeping excess movement in check.
WEAR TESTERS SAY: “ I love the energy I have in these shoes, they are light but powerful! Traction and stability are very strong as well.”

title: Brooks Men's Ghost 14 Neutral Running Shoe
description: Smooth roads are ahead when you put on the Ghost 14. This award-winning runner favorite now features 100% DNA LOFT in the midsole, for a softer, smoother ride. We’ve also improved the fit so the shoe adjusts even more comfortably to your foot.
features: THIS MEN'S SHOE IS FOR: Runners looking for a smooth ride that won’t distract from the fun of the run. The Ghost 14 offers a simplified midsole construction which creates more seamless transitions. This Brooks Ghost 14 is a certified PDAC A5500 Diabetic shoe and has been granted the APMA Seal of Acceptance. We recommend ordering Brooks running shoes 1/2 to one size larger than your dress shoe.

SUPPORT AND CUSHION: The Ghost 14 offers neutral support while providing high energizing cushioning. Ideal for road running, cross training, the gym or wherever you might want to take them! Predecessor: Ghost 13

BALANCED, SOFT CUSHIONING: BioMoGo DNA and DNA LOFT cushioning work together to provide a just-right softness underfoot without losing responsiveness and durability - yet it feels lighter than ever. DNA LOFT now makes up the entire midsole, for a softer, smoother, ride.
SMOOTH, STABLE RIDE: No matter how your foot lands, our Segmented Crash Pad - an integrated system of shock absorbers - will cushion every step and stride for smooth heel-to-toe transitions.
SOFT, SECURE, FIT: More strategic use of the 3D Fit Print upper technology provides structure that moves with the foot.

reviews.text: These Brooks running shoes are the best sneakers that you can buy. Very comfortable.

reviews.title: Brooks has lost a step on wear/quality, but still a very good shoe
reviews.text:
First, Brooks is a top running shoe manufacturer, and I always like buying their products, and they are to be applauded for releasing shoes in widths, which lets you get a shoe that fits, which is essential. If a shoe does not fit properly, then it will be extremely difficult to run (or walk any distance in). The Brooks Glycerin is one model up from the Ghost, that has better cushioning, but is no longer available in a Narrow width, and is more expensive, but the Ghost is a pretty good shoe on its own. I would have given the Ghost 5 stars, but the Ghost 14 is not quite perfect, having two areas where it could be better (and was better previously).

The first picture shows a Ghost 14 (on the left), next to a Ghost 13 (the previous model, on the right), and you can see the Ghost 14 has less tread, so wears out sooner, I would say roughly 50-75 miles of road (asphalt) running. The picture shows both shoes new. The Ghost 13 also was a little more cushioned, but you can offset that some by putting a different insole in the 14, and a lot of runners replace the insoles anyway. The thinner tread means less mileage on the 14s, but still probably as good as most of the competition, just no longer better here.

The second pictures shows the upper collar on a Ghost 14, and the fabric Brooks is using there (not so much on the 13 and earlier models) is nice and soft, but does not hold up. I generally see holes or failures at the top of the lace area, and on some shoes, towards the back collar area. You get a lot of fraying, sometimes holes, which is more an appearance problem than anything that would impact running in them, but means also you cannot wear them casually, at least where someone might see the failures. That may be an aspect that is supply chain related, they used to hold up better, but I have seen the problem on two pair of Ghost 14s, and other manufacturers do a bit better (probably needs a bit more nylon, to hold up longer).

I will say that the Ghost 14 has a narrower tongue at the top, that is shared with the 13 but was new there, and I have not seen it much in other shoes, but actually works very well, so I give kudos to Brooks on that design innovation. There is less chance that during a run the tongue will shift over into the forefoot, at least in a painful way, and you don't have to stop to shift it back.

So overall, particularly at this price point, the Brooks continues to be good value and one of the top shoes to consider, but as with anything, there are a couple of areas that could use further improvement.

reviews.title: Knock offs!! Just DON'T DO IT ✅

reviews.text: I own a pair of Lone Peak 6 size 11 which have a little toe allowance.  Same size 11 Olympus 4 literally had my toes scrunched along the front of the shoe!  May have to go one whole size up for proper fitting.  They also felt a LOT stiffer than the Lone Peaks, which surprised me given they are supposed to have maximum cushioning;  the Lone Peaks actually feel more cushy to me.  Returning the 11s and mulling over whether I should bother trying a 11.5 or a 12, considering how much stiffer they felt.

reviews.text: OK, so I was not expecting these to be comfortable for my 12.5hr shifts, nor was I expecting them to be durable. Surprise!! They are both. I am a nurse, enough said about comfort. I got poop on them, washed them in my washing machine, expecting to remove tattered and torn, I found them clean and INTACT!!!!! The color is just as bright as the day I  bought them. My coworkers are spending $150 or more on HOKA and I got these cheeeeap!! I love them!!!! Plus, when it rains they don't squeak????? I was so surprised, I don't know what to say about that. The heel is see thru and there isn't even any water inside after washing them. Sized very accurate, if anything they were 1/2 inch longer than expected. I wear a 7.5 in womens U.S. and these are not tight AT ALL, if I had gotten an 8, which I normally do when buying online and especially foreign, I would have been in trouble. Get them! I am getting another color as soon as I finish typing.

title: EZ-STIK 13.1 Half Marathon Decal Sticker 6" 5k 10k Running Shoes runnerA010
description: There is no background color. The surface that you apply the sticker to will become your background color. This will be a single color sticker. This is a DIE-CUT vinyl decal meaning that the background has been trimmed off. If there is a background color in the picture, it is used only as a representation. The background color will be the surface color you place the sticker on (or clear if you put it on a window). The decal will come with clear transfer tape, so you can easily apply it to anything you like (walls, windows, cars, mailbox, mirrors, laptops, etc etc etc). I use PREMIUM Oracal brand vinyl for all decals. Application is relatively easy. Your decal will come as THREE pieces - the backing paper, the sticker itself, and the clear transfer tape. Make sure you are applying to a CLEAN surface. You carefully pull the clear transfer tape up from the backing paper, making sure that it pulls the sticker up with it (if it does not, then firmly press down on it with a squee-gee or credit card or something similar until it sticks properly to the clear transfer tape). Then you apply the sticker and clear transfer tape to whatever surface you would like the decal on. You then use a squee-gee or credit card or something similar to firmly press down once again, making sure that the sticker STICKS, and then you carefully and slowly remove the clear transfer tape from the top, leaving behind only the sticker. I have found that on some surfaces (especially walls and wood surfaces), it helps to leave the clear transfer tape on for awhile to make sure everything is sticking well before removing it. I do not issue refunds or exchanges on vinyl decals. Please understand this before you bid. Some decals are more difficult to apply than others (especially the little ones!) - likewise, some surfaces are more difficult to apply decals to.

title: ASICS Women's GT-2000 4 Running Shoes
description:
The gt-2000 4 is the core runner’s bread and butter with its balance of cushioning and stability, outfitted by the comfortably supportive dynamic duomax and guidance trusstic system that also enhance gait efficiency. Our rear foot and forefoot gel cushioning systems are now even more adaptive, assisting mild to moderate over pronators alike with greater support, while the fluid ride midsole offers the ultimate ride.
In 1949, Mr. Kihachiro Onitsuka began his athletic footwear company (Onitsuka Co., Ltd.) by manufacturing basketball shoes out of his living room in Kobe, Japan. He chose the name ASICS for his company in 1977, based on a famous Latin phrase "Anima Sana In Corpore Sano," which, when translated, expresses the ancient ideal of "A Sound Mind in a Sound Body." Taking the acronym of this phrase, ASICS was founded on the belief that the best way to create a healthy and happy lifestyle is to promote total health and fitness. Today, ASICS offers a full line of performance-driven athletic shoes and technical active sports apparel and accessories dedicated to bringing harmony to the body and soul.
features: Impact Guidance System (I.G.S): ASICS design philosophy that employs linked componentry to enhance the foot's natural gait from heel strike to toe-off.
Dynamic duomax Support System: This evolution of duomax system enhances stability and support, with reduced weight and increased platform support.
Rear foot and Forefoot GEL Cushioning Systems: Attenuates shock during impact and toe-off phases, and allows movement in multiple planes as the foot transitions through the gait cycle.
Fluid ride: fluid ride provides the ultimate combination of bounce back and cushioning properties with reduced weight and exceptional durability.
Guidance Truss tic System: This Truss tic System integrates Guidance Line construction for enhanced gait efficiency while providing midfoot structural integrity.

reviews.title: Great shoe for an over-pronator like me
reviews.text: I've used the GT-2000 shoes over the last few years and have yet to have issue with them. I over-pronate pretty badly and this shoe offers great support for that issue; My knees thank me. I found the shoe to fit exactly true to size and for those reviews that say it's small, people tend to forget that your feet swell when you run, especially longer distances! My personal size foot is between a 6.5-7 and I typically wear a 7 shoe for running, dress, or sandals. I can't say I know the difference between the GT-2000 model numbers (1-5?) except for new-ness. I have no issue with wearing older models and like the cheaper prices. For reference, I run half marathons several times a year on city sidewalks, asphalt, dirt roads, and dirt trails.

reviews.title: This was a gift. Didn't fit. So, ...
reviews.text: This was a gift. Didn't fit. So, hearsay- I am not sure of the exact fit. They are exchanging for a bigger size though.

reviews.title: Great shoe but runs small
reviews.text: Great shoe, very supportive in the arch and heel. I love the bright colors of the Asics shoes. The only thing I would be leary of is the size of the shoe. It runs small. I wear an 8 and because of other reviews, bought a 8-1/2. They fit but are still a little snug. After wearing for a bit, they will loosen up enough to be great. If you have a wider foot, you may not like these particular shoes.

reviews.title: Color in photo is not quite accurate
reviews.text: Have always loved my Asics GT-2000.  32 marathons and our relationship continues!  My only comment about this particular color combo is the photo appears to be grey and more coral color.  When they arrived what looks like a coral color in the photo is closer to fluorescent orange!  They are a bit "loud".  If they had been full price I probably would not have chosen them because of this.  Too "loud" for my preferences.  However, given the clearance price I'll make do!  :)

reviews.title: ... been a fan of Asics and this did not disappoint!

The GEL-Venture 5 provides great fit and everyday comfort, with Rearfoot GEL Cushioning and a rugged outsole ideal for a variety of terrains.
In 1949, Mr. Kihachiro Onitsuka began his athletic footwear company (Onitsuka Co., Ltd.) by manufacturing basketball shoes out of his living room in Kobe, Japan. He chose the name ASICS for his company in 1977, based on a famous Latin phrase "Anima Sana In Corpore Sano," which, when translated, expresses the ancient ideal of "A Sound Mind in a Sound Body." Taking the acronym of this phrase, ASICS was founded on the belief that the best way to create a healthy and happy lifestyle is to promote total health and fitness. Today, ASICS offers a full line of performance-driven athletic shoes and technical active sports apparel and accessories dedicated to bringing harmony to the body and soul.

title: New Balance Men's 410 V6 Trail Running Shoe
description:
Be off-road ready in the New Balance 410v6 men’s trail shoe. Featuring a durable AT Tread rubber outsole, this shoe is fit for any adventure. Made with a sleek upper, ACTEVA midsole technology and a cushioned NB Comfort Insert, the versatile men’s running shoe is designed to keep you comfortable and stylish before, during and after your hike.
New Balance, is dedicated to helping athletes achieve their goals. It's been their mission for more than a century. It's why they don't spend money on celebrity endorsements. They spend it on research and development. It's why they don't design products to fit an image. They design them to fit. New Balance is driven to make the finest shoes for the same reason athletes lace them up: to achieve the very best.
features: ACTEVA midsole cushioning delivers versatile, flexible support
AT Tread outsole provides versatile traction during both on and off-road activities
Lightweight injection-molded EVA foam midsole provides lightweight cushioning
NB Comfort Insert offers additional cushioning

reviews.title: Cheap quality
reviews.text: These are wimpy tennis shoes.  They probably wont' make it a year.  I judge the quality by picking up the shoe and twisting in my hands.  I can easily warp these shoes.  I have some Merrills and I absolutely can't bend them up.

reviews.title: Not the best looking shoe but the most comfortable!
reviews.text: Man my feet hurt. And because I wear the same shoes everyday all day they break down pretty quickly.  These are perfect.  The color isn't my absolute favorite BUT that was the color that was on sale. Besides I'm nearly 50 so I'm not out to impress anyone lol.  They fit my feet perfectly and  there is no better feeling of new shoes when your old shoes broke down! Just enough support.

reviews.title: Great Walking Shoe!
reviews.text: I got these for at home. I like wearing shoes inside. So they need to be clean. I got these, and they are comfy and see like they will last a long time. They should, if I only wear them in my house.

reviews.title: Good fit in a large size
reviews.text: I bought these shoes as a gift for my 25 year old son, who wears a size 16. I know from past experience that New Balance provides a good, consistent fit in their large sizes, and this pair did not disappoint. The fit was great and my son liked the color and style.

title: Yontune 2X Headlights for Crocs/Sneakers, LED Shoe Lights for Night Safety Running Shoe Lights for Night Runner Funny Gifts for Hiking Camping Walking The Dogs (Red)
features: ⛈️【High Quality & Weatherproof】Our runner shoe lights are made of aluminum alloy and ABS plastic, IPX5 Waterproof, these lights for shoes are built to withstand the toughest rainstorm. Rather it be snow or heavy rain, our gear got your cover.

🔆【Lightweight & Bright】They are pretty lightweight (each light weights only 25g). It stays stable while you walk or run without you even notice. These shoe lights for night safety are bright which can increase your visibility to avoid tripping on things and seeing the path. Let you see and be seen safely in the dark from dusk till dawn.

💡【Upgraded Hidden Switch】Press on the head of the shoe light to turn on/off and switch 3 different modes base on your need (Always Bright, Flashing, or Flashing slowly). It can retain power for 72 hours on its highest setting. An essential safety equipment for any low-light activity.

✨【Easy to Install】Night runner shoe lights the bottom design allows you to fix the shoe light on your shoelace or straps firmly. Note: Please remove the insulating paper between the two batteries at first.

🏃🏽【Application to All Outdoor Activities】Runners shoe lights for night safety, these lights for shoes are hands-free lighting solution for runners, hikers, or any outdoor enthusiast. You can safely trek through mountains, trails, or your own neighborhood knowing you’ve got reliable, safe lighting at all times. Whether running, cycling, walking, hiking, camping, fishing, or walking your dog.

reviews.title: Work great
reviews.text: I was excited to receive these. I also have a pair that stick in the hole on the shoes. I prefer these, however, because you can adjust where the beam is directed by moving the heel strap around. I use my crocs for taking care of the chickens. So this is great for the walk to the coop every night.

reviews.title: Good quality
reviews.text: Great little product gives good light and I can pop them on my tennis shoes for camping.

reviews.title: Fun little headlights for your shoes
reviews.text: I've had these lights on my shoes full time for the last few days, and I really like them for evening walks.  They don't replace a flashlight, but they do light up a fair amount of the path that I wouldn't otherwise see with my small flashlight.  I've smacked them against car doors and chair rails a few times, and they've stayed solidly on my feet and are no worse for wear.  They are great for visibility for others too - your feet move a lot, and so do these lights.  Add flashing and you're much more visible either walking or on a bicycle.  I think they'd also be great for camping, and maybe at a dance party (flashing feet might be fun!)  My only thought is that they seem a little pricey, but they are one of the few that go on shoe laces and not just popping into holes in Crocs.  They're quite sturdy and battery life is great too.

reviews.title: Perfect for early morning/night walking
reviews.text: I bought these lights for an upcoming hike to the Grand Canyon in October. We need to start our hike before sunrise and thought these would be the perfect accessory to stop us from tripping in the dark. What I like - they are small and lightweight, with a secure clip for my shoes. The battery is a standard size. They are easy to turn off and on. I'm undecided on if these are really bright enough to be practical... is there a light - yes. Is it going to replace a flashlight - absolutely not. I don't know if I'd buy these again for the purpose of a hike, but they would be good if you are an early morning/late evening walker and runner and want additional lights for safety so cars, etc, can see you.

reviews.title: They are ok
reviews.text:
Batteries are not working. I have to replace them right from the start. I hope they will work.

They seem a bit heavy but I will use them. Safety is more important.
